items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: This message has been issued, because some minor flooding to riverside roads and footpaths is likely this afternoon, overnight tonight and into tomorrow morning. Water levels continue to remain high. This is due to a natural tide locking effect. High tidal water moving up the rivers from Great Yarmouth, is currently restricting the normal drainage out to sea at low tide, of the Broads river system. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry road in Horning. Be ready to take action to protect your property, if flooding is expected. We are monitoring the situation and are not expecting the situation to escalate. We will update this message by 10am tomorrow, Saturday 4th December 2021.

items.message: The flood alert for the Upper River Ouse has been removed as river levels have fallen below levels of concern.

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire
floodArea.riverOrSea: River Derwent, Sea Cut, River Hertford, Burniston Beck

items.message: The flood alert for the Upper River Derwent remains in force. River levels have risen as a result of rainfall and snowmelt over the past few days. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today, Friday 03/12/2021. No further significant rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours. Areas most at risk are low lying land and roads. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring the forecast. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses, and do not walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated on Friday afternoon 03/12/21, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: County Durham, Hartlepool, North Tyneside, South Tyneside, Sunderland

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
The risk of large waves and spray has now reduced, though standing water and debris may remain on coastal footpaths and promenades.
We continue to monitor the situation

items.description: The tidal River Waveney from Ellingham to Breydon Water
items.message: Levels are now well below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for no current flood risk from high tides.  Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

items.description: The tidal River Yare from Thorpe St Andrew to Breydon Water
items.message: Levels are now well below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for no current flood risk from high tides.  Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

Friday morning's tide at 10:15 on 03/12/2021 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with strong South Westerly Force 7 winds. The weather increases tide table values by 0.02 m. The total forecast tide is 6.00 metres Chart Datum (2.95 mAOD) at Littlehampton. For 2 hours either side of high tide, minimal flood impacts are expected. A small amount of water could find its way behind the beach and may pond on nearby land and fields including at Climping Street Car Park and Mill Lane. Friday evening's tide at 22:30 03/12/2021 is forecast to be 10cm higher, but accompanied by lighter winds and smaller waves. Saturday morning's tide at 10:45 04/12/2021 is forecast to be the highest of the week (3.19 mAOD) and again accompanied by strong winds. We continue to monitor the forecast. We recycled shingle in November and routinely check the condition of the beach at Climping. Shingle and debris can be thrown by large waves. Access could be restricted during and after high tide. Take care if visiting Climping beach. We will update this message by 14:00 on 03/12/2021.

items.description: The River Bure, Spixworth Beck and surrounding Becks
items.message: Levels are now well below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for no significant rainfall for today.  Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire, York

items.message: The flood alert for the lower river Derwent remains in force. River levels have risen as a result of snow-melt and rainfall. Consequently, flooding of property, roads and farmland is possible today, Friday 03/12/21. Areas most at risk are low lying land and roads. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring the forecast. Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated on Friday afternoon, 03/12/21, or as the situation changes.
